column4: I'm trying to get wi-fi working on my laptop -- I've installed ndiswrapper and installed the windows drivers. ndiswrapper -l says "driver present" but not "hardware present" can someone give me a hand?
What card do you have? Or what chipset does it use?
Check out this tut: http://fedoranews.org/mediawiki/index.php/How_To_Install_Your_Broadcom_BCM4318_Using_Ndiswrapper -- It's for Fedora, but you can easily adapt it to work with Ubuntu :)
Hmm.. Driver present? Does "iwconfig" show anything useful?
It should be working then. Go to System->Administration->Networking and see if you can connect to a WLAN from there
And then what? Try connecting to a WLAN..
Good... Not go to "Properties" and there should be a listbox to select detected WLANs from
Is this a laptop or desktop?
Try pressing a button which activates the wireless card. There should be one... Or is your wireless card external (PCMCIA, USB, etc)?
It probably won't light up... Now look at the list again ;)
That's odd... Try pressing the button again, but a bit harder? Mine doesn't work if I press it too softly - even if I think I've pressed it..
I'm not sure how to help... Let's try the terminal?
sudo ifconfig eth1 down; sudo ifconfig eth1 up
